Sorry, so what is it about it that doesn't work?  Is it that you're getting asked to do it on land and the experiment can only be done in water?

Took a quick look, but don't have time to dig deep, so couldn't find what I need in the Otter's download files.  What is the experiment, what part is it on?  What are the non-stock restrictions on the experiment (where can it be run, where can it not be run)?  What's the contract that you received look like?

> 
> 
> 20 minutes ago, nightingale said:
> 
> 
> Took a quick look, but don't have time to dig deep, so couldn't find what I need in the Otter's download files.  What is the experiment, what part is it on?  What are the non-stock restrictions on the experiment (where can it be run, where can it not be run)?  What's the contract that you received look like?
> 

Actually, my mistake and apologies for sending you in the wrong direction, it's actually a DMagic Orbital Science instrument, not in the Otter submersible mod. There is a sample net part in the 'otter' mod, but that isn't used for any contracts.

The experiment is called bathymetry and it's using the part of the same name (it's inside the RoverScience file inside DMOS). Not sure if the restrictions are non-stock, but as you can probably infer, it can only be used underwater, the instrument itself has to be submerged. The contract, um, I forget exactly atm, but it was the 'biome study of Kerbins shores' one.

The contract had the required situation correct. Also, there's two types of bathymetry experiments you can get, shallow water and deep water, that might cause the contract to be confused.

**Edited <time datetime="2016-02-07T16:23:17Z" title="02/07/2016 04:23  PM" data-short="8 yr">February 7, 2016</time> by smjjames**

Got it, it was the fix for the Flats/Greater Flats that was breaking it.  Fixed for next release (of Contract Configurator).
Nice mod,  Thank you ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

This isn't exactly your problem, but apparently you can't do science at the LV1 astronaut complex without getting up high. This makes early field research contracts difficult.

[http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/5298](http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/5298)

> 
> 
> 49 minutes ago, severedsolo said:
> 
> 
> This isn't exactly your problem, but apparently you can't do science at the LV1 astronaut complex without getting up high. This makes early field research contracts difficult.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/5298](http://bugs.kerbalspaceprogram.com/issues/5298)
> 

Interesting, I wasn't aware of that one!  Not sure if there's much to be done here...  if it isn't fixed in 1.1 maybe I'll put a note/warning in the contract. Raised [#16](https://github.com/jrossignol/ContractPack-FieldResearch/issues/16).

Fixed some issues in the Scientist contract as reported by [@kcs123](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/127158-kcs123/) - thanks!  Download [here](https://github.com/jrossignol/ContractPack-FieldResearch/releases/tag/1.1.6).

**ContractPack-FieldResearch 1.1.6**

- Prevent scientist contract from completing out of order (thanks kcs123).
- Fix impossible to complete surface samples in Scientist contract (thanks kcs123).

You may want to ban the "Plant Growth" science point from the [Planetary Base Systems](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/114758-wip105-kerbal-planetary-base-systems-v0210-update-17112015/) mod - the greenhouse part is heavy and can be quite unwieldy for return missions.

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, Spheniscine said:
> 
> 
> You may want to ban the "Plant Growth" science point from the [Planetary Base Systems](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/114758-wip105-kerbal-planetary-base-systems-v0210-update-17112015/) mod - the greenhouse part is heavy and can be quite unwieldy for return missions.
> 

Ah, but you don't need to return the greenhouse - you can put the experiements into any ScienceContainer (like a command pod) via EVA transfer and return it that way.

Hi I have a small question:

Do you have a source for the coordinates of those rare locations to splashdown on land? I'm trying to do this with stock KSP right now and its tedious. But I remember your pack used to generate waypoints for those locations. Is there a way to get those coordinates?

> 
>

>

> Do you have a source for the coordinates of those rare locations to splashdown on land? I'm trying to do this with stock KSP right now and its tedious. But I remember your pack used to generate waypoints for those locations. Is there a way to get those coordinates?
> 

Well, if you mean source like source code, then have a look [here](https://github.com/jrossignol/ContractConfigurator/blob/master/source/ContractConfigurator/ScenarioModules/BiomeTracker.cs).

If you just want the coordinates that it generates, then search for BiomeTracker in your save file.

I'm having this same issue. It's not just the Solar Wind Spectromoter. There are a few experiment in the pack that can't be done in atmos or without atmos. The contracts don't seem to mind assigning them to impossible biomes however.

So far, I've seen them pop up in biome study, and experiments around KSC contracts, but I've only just started a fresh game.

Thanks a ton. Love the Mod! <3

[@Z-Key Aerospace](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/138926-z-key-aerospace/) has their own system for handling mod-science with special requirements - bring it up with him and he can *probably* fix it without too much trouble.

Ya, seems the contracts I was looking at must have been from before the update. I canceled them, and the new ones spawning seem to only have possible experiments. Sorry for bugging you about an already resolved issue.

![l9C9Pmv.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/l9C9Pmv.jpg)

The bug that once allowed multiple copies of the same contract to be take/completable at once, has somehow snuck in again. I believe this was addressed previously? Posting here and in field research, as I'm not sure if this, or that mod is the source.

Edit: both are at latest versions.

New release, for KSP 1.0.5 and 1.1.  Download [here](https://github.com/jrossignol/ContractPack-FieldResearch/releases/tag/1.1.7)!

**ContractPack-FieldResearch 1.1.7**

- Fixed uniqueness check on 'scrap science' contract (thanks vardicd).

Hello, many thanks for this mod. But i have one question to the follow mission:

Biom: Kerbin Grassland

Situation: Splashed down

experiment: crew; mystery goo; EVA

I was starting with a smal booster and jumpt on the grasland....

I have no idea what the system want´s from me. Splashed down means on the water. But i must do it on biom grasland.

What can i do?
If you look it the tracking station, you should see some waypoint markers pointing you to suggested locations where you can complete those particular missions.
